lead_paragraph: A federal judge said the proposed deal with the city did not go far enough in its oversight of a department that had become “accustomed to disregarding” court orders.

byline.original: By MATT APUZZO and ADAM GOLDMAN

headline.print_headline: Judge Halts Deal  on Surveillance  by Police Dept.
headline.main: Judge Rejects Settlement Over Surveillance of Muslims by New York Police Department

snippet: A federal judge said the proposed deal with the city did not go far enough in its oversight of a department that had become “accustomed to disregarding” court orders....
abstract: Federal Judge Charles S Haight Jr rejects proposed settlement of lawsuit filed against New York City Police Dept over its surveillance of Muslim communities in decade after Sept 11 terrorist attacks, saying settlement is too lenient on agency; lawyers for both sides will need to renegotiate settlement or fight lawsuit in court.
